isis.stitle: TSI 03-12-09 - Inability to Run an Air Management Test

subjectgroup.subject: Inability to Run an Air Management Test

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to HT530 I-6 engines equipped with the EVRT® Electronically Controlled Turbocharger beginning with engine serial number 1319430.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing diagnostic or service procedures on the engine or vehicle. Read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the service manual for this engine.

geninfo.para: Service Technicians diagnosing problems related to the EVRT® Electronically Controlled Turbocharger are often called on to run an air management test. This test has been available since February 2003. The air management test will not run if the EVRT® Electronically Controlled Turbocharger equipped engine being evaluated has a calibration prior to PVD6AU01.
Check which calibration is in the Engine Control Module (ECM) by opening MasterDiagnostics® software and click VIN+ on the tool bar.
The calibration will be listed as the reference number in one of the windows that comes up.

If the engine calibration is required to run this test, the service technician, during programming, must check the box that asks if the ECM is being replaced. Then, prior calibrations will automatically update to the latest available when the programming is completed.

svcproc.title: Initiate Air Management Test
svcproc.para: This test can only be done with the Electronic Service Tool (EST) and MasterDiagnostic® software is required. The Standard Test must be done before doing the Air Management Test.
The Air Management Test allows the technician to check the operation of the air management system and the turbocharger control valve.
During the Air Management Test, the ECM commands the turbocharger through a step test sequence so technicians can determine if actuators and the Air Management System are performing as expected.
When the test is done, the ECM restores normal engine operation.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Running Tests from the drop down menu.
Select I6 with EVRT from the drop down menu.
From Key On Engine Running Diagnostics menu, select Air Management Test, and click run to start the test.

svcproc.para: The air management test will perform the following steps:

item.para: Turbocharger duty offset will go to 0.
Engine RPM will increase above idle and the turbocharger vanes will open completely. The expected Manifold Absolute Pressure (MAP) sensor reading at this point is 0 or very low psi.
The ECM will command medium duty cycle, partially closing the vanes in the turbocharger. The expected MAP sensor reading at this point is greater than 1 psi.
The ECM will command high duty cycle, fully closing the vanes in the turbocharger. The expected MAP sensor reading at this point is greater than 4 psi.

para.emph: NOTE: The ECM will not log Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTC) during the air management test. Changes in the MAP reading during the test indicates that the vanes in the turbocharger are operational.

item.para: The engine RPM will return to idle.

note.para: Using the VGT section of the Key-On Engine-Running Diagnostics; allows turbocharger control to be stepped manually through each cycle.
